commit_message:
Allowed nested resource metadata in POST'd samples

Fixes bug 1302664

Previously, posting samples with nested metadata caused the mongo
driver to fail on the embedded period in a metadata key.

Now, we explicitly unwind the flattened resource metadata before
publishing the sample.

Change-Id: Ibb0980afc880218962328a9b7fe792015d58d1d2
(cherry picked from commit 2e8fa7c48fe4cca5674f895bd3985dc9243a9702)

subject: Introduces escaping in Horizon/Orchestration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-08 15:13:57.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/tests.py', 'horizon/templates/horizon/common/_form_fields.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/templates/stacks/_detail_overview.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/mappings.py'], 'message': 'Introduces escaping in Horizon/Orchestration

1) Escape help_text a second time to avoid bootstrap tooltip XSS issue

The "Description" parameter in a Heat template is used to populate
a help_text tooltip in the dynamically generated Heat form. Bootstrap
inserts this tooltip into the DOM using .html() which undoes any
escaping we do in Django (it should be using .text()).

This was fixed by forcing the help_text content to be escaped a second
time. The issue itself is mitigated in bootstrap.js release 2.0.3
(ours is currently 2.0.1).

2) Properly escape untrusted Heat template 'outputs'

The 'outputs' parameter in a Heat template was included in a Django
template with HTML autoescaping turned off. Malicious HTML content
could be included in a Heat template and would be rendered by Horizon
when details about a created stack were displayed.

This was fixed by not disabling autoescaping and explicitly escaping
untrusted values in any strings that are later marked "safe" to render
without further escaping.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/mappings.py

Change-Id: Icd9f9d9ca77068b12227d77469773a325c840001
Closes-Bug: #1289033
Co-Authored-By: Kieran Spear <kispear@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Introduces escaping in Horizon/Orchestration

1) Escape help_text a second time to avoid bootstrap tooltip XSS issue

The "Description" parameter in a Heat template is used to populate
a help_text tooltip in the dynamically generated Heat form. Bootstrap
inserts this tooltip into the DOM using .html() which undoes any
escaping we do in Django (it should be using .text()).

This was fixed by forcing the help_text content to be escaped a second
time. The issue itself is mitigated in bootstrap.js release 2.0.3
(ours is currently 2.0.1).

2) Properly escape untrusted Heat template 'outputs'

The 'outputs' parameter in a Heat template was included in a Django
template with HTML autoescaping turned off. Malicious HTML content
could be included in a Heat template and would be rendered by Horizon
when details about a created stack were displayed.

This was fixed by not disabling autoescaping and explicitly escaping
untrusted values in any strings that are later marked "safe" to render
without further escaping.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/mappings.py

Change-Id: Icd9f9d9ca77068b12227d77469773a325c840001
Closes-Bug: #1289033
Co-Authored-By: Kieran Spear <kispear@gmail.com>

subject: Fix tgt target in cinder element
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-28 20:00:24.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cinder/install.d/73-cinder'], 'message': 'Fix tgt target in cinder element

The package install version creates a file at /etc/tgt/conf.d/cinder.conf
and the cinder element has been adding an additional file. This would have
the effect of the source install working properly, but the package install
would end up creating volumes in /etc/cinder/volume instead of /mnt/state.

This patch changes the tgt target to be written to the existing file to
bring both the source and package installs to behave the same.

Change-Id: Ieeaa9518d6ed50595fbd70f1bbf0a17e3b5b1894
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tgt target in cinder element

The package install version creates a file at /etc/tgt/conf.d/cinder.conf
and the cinder element has been adding an additional file. This would have
the effect of the source install working properly, but the package install
would end up creating volumes in /etc/cinder/volume instead of /mnt/state.

This patch changes the tgt target to be written to the existing file to
bring both the source and package installs to behave the same.

Change-Id: Ieeaa9518d6ed50595fbd70f1bbf0a17e3b5b1894

commit_message:
Fixes messages logged on Glance plugin retries

Retry logic is now being used for both upload_vhd and download_vhd,
but nova/virt/xenapi/client/session.py still had 'upload_vhd'
hardcoded in its logged messages. This change causes it to accept the
function being used as an argument and display that.

Fixes-Bug: #1265054
Change-Id: I6203aef81960078f92fa7839e47ee1c84df95745

commit_message:
Honor suspend/pause config switches in scenario tests

Some tests missed checking for compute features as
set in compute-feature-enabled section in tempest.conf.

Reduce double-coverage of pause/suspend tests between
basic and advanced server tests by removing pause and
suspend actions in basic ops test.

Closes-bug: 1296858

Change-Id: I80d785bb5b325ccfac3c5cfd9d076718cf587e80

commit_message:
Unify backend logging

Make account, object, and container servers construct log lines using the
same utility function so they will produce identically formatted lines.

This change reorders the fields logged for the account server.

This change also adds the "additional info" field to the two servers that
didn't log that field.  This makes the log lines identical across all 3
servers.  If people don't like that, I can take that out.  I think it makes
the documentation, parsing of the log lines, and the code a tad cleaner.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I268dc0df9dd07afa5382592a28ea37b96c6c2f44
Closes-Bug: 1280955

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded /tftpboot/ from token's tftp path

Since file to be fetched from the root tftp directory it shouldn't
contain any hardcoded path. Additionaly it eliminates bearing with
map-file containing regular expressions for tftp path replacement.

Change-Id: Iee1672834f735d7dfefce43000540522e1d053b9
Closes-Bug: #1291533

subject: Correct test boundary for libvirt_driver.get_info
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-07 21:27:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py'], 'message': 'Correct test boundary for libvirt_driver.get_info

The test_get_domain_info_with_more_return() unit test was causing
failure on some systems where lxml was not capable of handling None for
the xml to parse. However, our unit tests should not be testing libvirt;
the unit tests in libvirt already do that. Our unit tests should simply
test the code boundaries of the unit of code that they wish to stress,
and not anything further.

This patch changes the unit test in question to only test the code
within the libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver.get_info() method, and nothing
more, and in doing so, we remove any calls at all to libvirt and mock
out where the code passes the boundaries of the get_info() method.

Change-Id: I022cc331a980c2a4d98f16d2d77b24839b528464
Closes-bug: #1301602
'}]
commit_message:
Correct test boundary for libvirt_driver.get_info

The test_get_domain_info_with_more_return() unit test was causing
failure on some systems where lxml was not capable of handling None for
the xml to parse. However, our unit tests should not be testing libvirt;
the unit tests in libvirt already do that. Our unit tests should simply
test the code boundaries of the unit of code that they wish to stress,
and not anything further.

This patch changes the unit test in question to only test the code
within the libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver.get_info() method, and nothing
more, and in doing so, we remove any calls at all to libvirt and mock
out where the code passes the boundaries of the get_info() method.

Change-Id: I022cc331a980c2a4d98f16d2d77b24839b528464
Closes-bug: #1301602

commit_message:
Add return value to some network API methods

Add return value to api methods add_fixed_ip_to_instance() and
remove_fixed_ip_from_instance(). This allows the @refresh_cache
decorator to use returned nw_info model for updating instance
info cache instead of needing to make another rpc call to get
that same information.

Tests are added to make sure return values are used by the
refresh_cache decorator for methods where the rpc call returns
with the necessary nw_info model.

Change-Id: I748e4db9de62d82e4dbcb0b9c444b16dabf0ec5d
Partial-Bug: #1284345

subject: Propose: VMware vm_ref (aka vm_util) refactor
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-01 19:54:55.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/vmware-vm-ref-refactor.rst'], 'message': 'Propose: VMware vm_ref (aka vm_util) refactor

Improper use of virtual machine references (vm_ref) in vm_util.py is the
source of many critical and high priority bugs. Refactoring this utility
so that there is one-right-way to get a virtual machine reference will
simplify the process of adding features to the driver and eliminate bugs.

related to blueprint vmware-vm-ref-refactor

Change-Id: I883ce071e91bc8c6b11a3960b093a21af026ad7b
'}]
commit_message:
Propose: VMware vm_ref (aka vm_util) refactor

Improper use of virtual machine references (vm_ref) in vm_util.py is the
source of many critical and high priority bugs. Refactoring this utility
so that there is one-right-way to get a virtual machine reference will
simplify the process of adding features to the driver and eliminate bugs.

related to blueprint vmware-vm-ref-refactor

Change-Id: I883ce071e91bc8c6b11a3960b093a21af026ad7b

commit_message:
Verify the create/delete volume APIs attributes

This patch adds the JSON schema for volume create & delete APIs
and validate the response of Nova Volume list APIs with added JSON
schema to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of Nova API volume create is the below:

{
    "volume": {
        "id": "%(uuid)s",
        "status": "in-use",
        "displayName": "%(volume_name)s", null
        "availabilityZone": "zone1:host1",
        "createdAt":  "%(timestamp)s",
        "displayDescription": "%(volume_desc)s",
        "volumeType": "Backup",
        "snapshotId": null,
        "metadata": {},
        "size": 100,
        "attachments": [
            { "device": "/",
              "serverId": "%(uuid)s",
              "id": "%(uuid)s",
              "volumeId": "%(uuid)s"
            }
        ]
    }
}

delete volume API does not return any response body.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I84069dae64a70bc2a4f2313bb3da4e86630e4b1b

commit_message:
Reuse module `exceptions` from Oslo

The exception module in oslo common code and in keystoneclient are similar.
In case of unification openstack clients, we should use modules from Oslo.

Changes of this patch:
- imported exceptions from common code instead of `apiclient.exception`
- added aliases for exceptions which was renamed
(reason: backwards compatibility)
- moved exceptions `EmptyCatalog` from `apiclient.exception` to `exceptions`
- cleaned `apiclient.exception` from duplicated exceptions
- `apiclient.__init__` and `apiclient.exceptions` are kept and labeled as
'deprecated'(reason: backwards compatibility)

bp common-client-library-2

Change-Id: Iedf4e5d753d4278d81751ba0f55fdef3566b56de

commit_message:
Add service-delete command

In patch I655a7f818bb59c8971feb5841feeefafc3a4580a from nova, a new
method to the compute API was added to delete a retired service.

This patch adds support to novaclient for this with a new command called
service-delete that expects the service's id.

Change-Id: I575dbfb5f834ce88da523c80214cd2e16cc4248e

commit_message:
1288419 TypeError extending non-existent volume

If a user tries to attach a non-existant volume to an instance (open two
tabs, delete the volume in one, extend in the other) a TypeError is
raised here:

    volumes = self.get_object()
    attachments = [att for att in volumes.attachments if att]

volumes is None.

Change-Id: I5a9bbf6ac1ae315690bda9f74aa0cc837cc7540c
Closes-Bug: 1288419

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 9101, 'name': 'wanghong', 'email': 'reviewwanghong@126.com', 'username': 'wanghong'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-04 12:34:22.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/trust/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/test_v3_auth.py', 'keystone/tests/test_v3.py'], 'message': 'Fix response for missing attributes in trust

Related-Bug:#1278738

Currently, when the "impersonation" attribute is missing from the trust,
the response shows the error message provided by the backend, which is a
problem since it exposes the backend that is being used. This patch sets
the "impersonation" attribute as mandatory, as specified in the API, in
the "OpenStack Identity API v3 OS-TRUST Extension" document. Thus,
sending an appropriate error response if this attribute is missing.

Additionally, the "trustee_user_id" is now checked in the same way and
keystone will return similar response if this attribute is missing.

Change-Id: Id20fec6798e54d169662b68413591963481405c8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix response for missing attributes in trust

Related-Bug:#1278738

Currently, when the "impersonation" attribute is missing from the trust,
the response shows the error message provided by the backend, which is a
problem since it exposes the backend that is being used. This patch sets
the "impersonation" attribute as mandatory, as specified in the API, in
the "OpenStack Identity API v3 OS-TRUST Extension" document. Thus,
sending an appropriate error response if this attribute is missing.

Additionally, the "trustee_user_id" is now checked in the same way and
keystone will return similar response if this attribute is missing.

Change-Id: Id20fec6798e54d169662b68413591963481405c8

revisions:

Currently any user can attach an interface to a neutron
external network, if the neutron plugin supports the port
binding extension.
In this case, nova will create neutron ports using the admin
client, thus bypassing neutron authZ checks for creating ports
on external networks.

This patch adds a check in nova to verify the API request has an
admin context when a request for an interface is made on a
neutron external network.

Change-Id: I5fb0bdcbf19eb82746ea3b192c1f65899bfb3c0b
Closes-Bug: 1284718
(cherry picked from commit 7d1b4117fda7709307a35e56625cfa7709a6b795)
'}]
commit_message:
Require admin context for interfaces on ext network

Currently any user can attach an interface to a neutron
external network, if the neutron plugin supports the port
binding extension.
In this case, nova will create neutron ports using the admin
client, thus bypassing neutron authZ checks for creating ports
on external networks.

This patch adds a check in nova to verify the API request has an
admin context when a request for an interface is made on a
neutron external network.

Change-Id: I5fb0bdcbf19eb82746ea3b192c1f65899bfb3c0b
Closes-Bug: 1284718
(cherry picked from commit 7d1b4117fda7709307a35e56625cfa7709a6b795)

commit_message:
Allowed nested resource metadata in POST'd samples

Fixes bug 1302664

Previously, posting samples with nested metadata caused the mongo
driver to fail on the embedded period in a metadata key.

Now, we explicitly unwind the flattened resource metadata before
publishing the sample.

Change-Id: Ibb0980afc880218962328a9b7fe792015d58d1d2

commit_message:
Verify delete quota response of V2/V3 APIs

This patch adds the JSON schema for response status of Nova quota delete APIs
to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

delete quota does not return the response body.
Response status of above APIs is below:
V2: 202
V3: 204

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I3113e3a07937bd7cb44a19e5ef4a5fb880ce3721

commit_message:
Use consistent hash type in Berksfile

This change uses consistent hash types in the Berksfile. Before
there were two different assignments:
  cookbook "statsd",
    :git => "git://github.com/att-cloud/cookbook-statsd.git"
  cookbook "openstack-common",
    git: "git://github.com/stackforge/cookbook-openstack-common.git"

This fixes that issue so they are both consistent.

Change-Id: Id20e2249b1f00a4abd90639243e4a1e600a64c47

commit_message:
Enable ServerGroup scheduler filters by default

The Icehouse release includes a server group REST API. For these
groups to actually function properly, the server group scheduler
filters must be enabled. So, these filters should be enabled by
default since the API is also enabled by default. If the API is not
used, the scheduler filters will be a no-op.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ia52d7fcfff52377d8beae2acd9b7eba9c6c74e09
Closes-bug: #1303983

commit_message:
Fix Jenkins translation jobs

The -propose-translation-update and -upstream-translation-update
jobs do not update from transifex since our po files contain
duplicate entries where obsolete entries duplicate normal entries.

Remove all obsolete entries to fix the jobs.

Change-Id: Ib0fab723f245a87bb116ca21db31841574f7dc7f
Closes-Bug: #1299349

commit_message:
Revert "Use debug level logging during unit tests"

This change made the subunit_log 190 MB on every run (14MB
in the gz version). It also dramatically increases the
memory needed to run unit tests. We need to revert and
come at this problem with fresh eyes to address the problem
at hand without effectively overrunning people's environments.

This reverts commit f9090b0bd796f8c2fdf8d0a23173f3adee71b3df.

Change-Id: Ia1cfc3d874ddf4f8ee2037b487d22f968585854e

Innodb buffer pool size in mysql config file is now set to 592M,

(this should be sufficient for default devtest setup). A patch which

Change-Id: I0d2529abe51d4dc34415bf6c40da7a267bf3e65b
'}]
commit_message:
Add mysql innodb buffer pool size

Innodb buffer pool size in mysql config file is now set to 592M,
this value is for VMs with 2G RAM too much. This patch makes the
pool size configurable and decreases default value to 100 MB
(this should be sufficient for default devtest setup). A patch which
for tripleo-image-element which sets this value in my.cnf will follow.

Change-Id: I0d2529abe51d4dc34415bf6c40da7a267bf3e65b

subject: Delete routers that are requested but not reported as active
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-08 12:23:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Delete routers that are requested but not reported as active

There are two cases that I can think of that result in a router being
requested but not reported as active.  One is that admin_state_up has
been set to False.  In this case, the router is never removed and
continues to be operational.

The other case is if a router is changed and then deleted before the
change is processed.  In this case, it is prudent to be sure that the
router is queued for deletion.

Change-Id: I4738f599a18f0d130cc8ad4d4dafc488eec75ffd
Closes-Bug: #1215387
(cherry picked from commit 9da60d0a417dd70c16ae34f5877c564e425e4cf8)
'}]
commit_message:
Delete routers that are requested but not reported as active

There are two cases that I can think of that result in a router being
requested but not reported as active.  One is that admin_state_up has
been set to False.  In this case, the router is never removed and
continues to be operational.

The other case is if a router is changed and then deleted before the
change is processed.  In this case, it is prudent to be sure that the
router is queued for deletion.

Change-Id: I4738f599a18f0d130cc8ad4d4dafc488eec75ffd
Closes-Bug: #1215387
(cherry picked from commit 9da60d0a417dd70c16ae34f5877c564e425e4cf8)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-08 12:18:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_attributes.py', 'neutron/api/v2/attributes.py'], 'message': "Fix _validate_mac_address method

The method _validate_mac_address previously used: netaddr.EUI(data)
which would convert data passed in to the correct mac_address representation.
For example if data=123 it would return: EUI('00-00-00-00-00-7B'). To fix
this issue I used netaddr.valid_mac() instead which returns a bool if a mac is
valid or not and does not raise. Note this file needs some improvements to
improve how exception handling is done that will come later.

Change-Id: I4fb868e40abbad9e743028cc768f47ca9b3e0e70
Closes-bug: 1291163
(cherry picked from commit b9390333a146d0435710f85d365318268e267fc3)

commit_message:
Fix _validate_mac_address method

The method _validate_mac_address previously used: netaddr.EUI(data)
which would convert data passed in to the correct mac_address representation.
For example if data=123 it would return: EUI('00-00-00-00-00-7B'). To fix
this issue I used netaddr.valid_mac() instead which returns a bool if a mac is
valid or not and does not raise. Note this file needs some improvements to
improve how exception handling is done that will come later.

Change-Id: I4fb868e40abbad9e743028cc768f47ca9b3e0e70
Closes-bug: 1291163
(cherry picked from commit b9390333a146d0435710f85d365318268e267fc3)

commit_message:
Make build_sphinx warning proof

This commit makes changes to the rst files so sphinx will not throw any
warnings. The implemented section of the index is removed, we can add
it back when a specification is implemented and we move it into that
directory.

commit_message:
Prepare network_checker for ci

Vagrant will spawn virtualbox vm with 3 interfaces
with 2 of them in same network (which will be handy for some debug)

eth1 and eth2 will be controlled by dhcp server in same network

This approach has couple of requirements:
1. virtualbox installed on jenkins node
2. vagrant installed on jenkins node
3. added precise64 box for vagrant

vagrant up - will create vm and install all necessery packages

to run tests:
vagrant ssh -c 'sudo py.test /vagrant/'

will run tests for network_checker and dhcpchecker
exit status will be non-zero in case of errors
sudo is required for capturing data on ifaces

To make docker approach to work:
1. Share linux drivers for docker containter (netchecker uses modprobe 8021q)
2. setup dnsmasq on same bridge which this docker image is using

Tests can be started on local machine with help of vde switch:
py.test --vde ./
This will create vde_switch and tap ifaces (tap11, tap12)

Related to blueprint fuel-network-checks-ci
Change-Id: Ieefca56f31db988a610870710ec9cb0ad1a0d6a6

commit_message:
Sync oslo-incubator code

Sync code to commit: b7ad6ddab8b1d61bf4f52ccaa461a9d68809747b

The oslo db API have been changed, so sqlalchemy driver have been updated
to match these changes.
We now use sqlalchemy/migration.py from oslo.db instead of the
ceilometer one.
The unused alembic code have been removed, because it is handled by
oslo.db now.

Closes bug: #1293409

Change-Id: I480d678a7165f32b92c5c9b4c55491c0edbc0991

commit_message:
Remove local engine

The local engine is replaced in process executor using the oslo.messaging
fake transport.  The local engine module is removed here along with related
unit tests. Some unit tests are rewritten to use the ScalableEngine. An
EngineTestCase is included in the base module of tests to simplify engine
testing.

Change-Id: I1a49a53eac87a209660c493fd7c3fe3e914fd092
Implements: blueprint mistral-inproc-executor

commit_message:
Added 'destroy' method that is called on deleted instances

Added ability to modify/remove data from structures (like Heat
templates) via jsonpatch and thus added ability to clean up Heat
resources that was obtained by deleted instances

Closes bug: #1296624

Change-Id: I4db226a5ab00ff363f8b5d44a5d690df942622e8

commit_message:
RBD backend: use ensure_resource

In the case we want to declare more than one backend using RBD driver,
we have a resource dupplication which could be fixed by using stlib
functions.

Closes-bug #1294138
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Add os-migration tests for Nova v2 API

v2 os-migration API returns a body which includes the info like:

  {
    "migrations": [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "status": "finished",
        "instance_uuid": "e9e4fdd7-f956-44ff-bfeb-d654a96ab3a2",
        "source_node": "localhost-dev",
        "source_compute": "localhost-dev",
        "dest_node": "localhost-dev",
        "dest_compute": "localhost-dev",
        "dest_host": "192.168.11.100",
        "old_instance_type_id": 6,
        "new_instance_type_id": 2,
        "created_at": "2014-03-18T00:14:49.000000",
        "updated_at": "2014-03-18T00:15:15.000000"
      }
    ]
  }

This patch adds this API tests.

This patch adds tests for JSON format only without XML format because
the XML support has been marked as deprecated in Nova with the commit
I4acc15ce5f487738bb34a95c2261a5d05d827d8d and it will be removed in
Juno cycle.

Change-Id: I0e19b776313eff98d157e1249333174908061798

commit_message:
Iterate over provided elements first

To ensure that we have the list of provided elements from the
command line before looking up dependencies, use a deque and
popleft() to take the elements on a first-in/first-out basis.

Change-Id: I0a2c21fa081763fd3cc8358be25dafeee1ed4718
Closes-Bug: #1303911

Change-Id: I3f4b386019c085d0507a1352768c905506dc15f9

commit_message:
Add script to check that scripts are executable

DIB elements are largely built out of scripts named EG bar.d/99-foo. If
these scripts aren't executable, they don't get executed, which is
usually an error. This script provides an easy way to find these errors,
saving developer time.

Change-Id: I3f4b386019c085d0507a1352768c905506dc15f9

commit_message:
debian: use sudo to create file in the chroot

The ${TARGET_ROOT} chroot is owned by the root user.

Without this change, the build will fail for a standard user
with a “Permission denied” error.

Change-Id: I6eb87d3a14292da5620bdfd623ea7ef846fe2af6

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7125, 'name': 'Alexander Ignatov', 'email': 'aignatov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aignatov'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7428, 'name': 'Yaroslav Lobankov', 'email': 'lobankovyv@gmail.com', 'username': 'ylobankov'}, {'_account_id': 8091, 'name': 'Trevor McKay', 'email': 'tmckay@redhat.com', 'username': 'tmckay'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-08 09:21:41.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/swift/swift_helper.py', 'sahara/conductor/resource.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/conductor/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Add a custom filter method to scan wrapped dict results

Basic filtering is available via Resource._filter_fields and
Resource._children but partial filtering of fields is not supported.

This change allows a Resource to define custom sanitization methods
for individual fields. The specified method is applied after the
field has been generated.

For nested structures, particularly when elements are not Resource
types, it is easier to scan the field after generation and remove
specific elements than it is to modify the recursive descent already
implemented in to_wrapped_dict().

JobExecutions are filtered with this mechanism to set swift credential
values to empty strings and to remove the 'conf' section reported
for running Oozie actions.

Closes-Bug: #1300291
Change-Id: Ifb0b99a3e13d40306139b0d0021aead69e870205
(cherry picked from commit 3367d9c3632629b900b618c80261d8b6de8086ee)
"}]
commit_message:
Add a custom filter method to scan wrapped dict results

Basic filtering is available via Resource._filter_fields and
Resource._children but partial filtering of fields is not supported.

This change allows a Resource to define custom sanitization methods
for individual fields. The specified method is applied after the
field has been generated.

For nested structures, particularly when elements are not Resource
types, it is easier to scan the field after generation and remove
specific elements than it is to modify the recursive descent already
implemented in to_wrapped_dict().

JobExecutions are filtered with this mechanism to set swift credential
values to empty strings and to remove the 'conf' section reported
for running Oozie actions.

Closes-Bug: #1300291
Change-Id: Ifb0b99a3e13d40306139b0d0021aead69e870205
(cherry picked from commit 3367d9c3632629b900b618c80261d8b6de8086ee)

commit_message:
Improve GET packages API call

Add 'search' and 'type' parameters

Allows to search any text occurrence in db
Support several params with 3 kinds od delimeters: space, comma and semicolon

Type allows to filter packages only by specified type

Partially-implements blueprint murano-repository-api-v2
Closes-Bug: #1304344

Change-Id: I4edef62dec2a3cf14506bede2a7482ed957c9a7e

commit_message:
Removed possibility to run job w/o Oozie

* Added a validation function which checks if cluster contains oozie
  service in its node groups
* Added unit-test covers both valid and invalid cases when cluster
  contains and doesn't oozie service in attempt of job execution
* Fixed small issue in unit tests in validation utils where pathced
  api.get_cluster function had never been unpatched.

Change-Id: I5c5de6cfb1812ff6795797df63b8ec0292395fd1
Closes-Bug: #1291649
(cherry picked from commit cd583756a0d7befccb71f82059d4b7b8e1718d12)

commit_message:
Added rackawareness to Hadoop 2 in vanilla plugin

* Now Hadoop 2.3.0 in vanilla is able to push topology data for
  datanodes and nodemanagers
* Only 3-level topology (rackawareness) pushes to nodes. Why 4-level is
  not? Because this is not implemented in YARN yet (see YARN-18 and YARN-19):
  https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-8468
* Even if admin configures 4-level topology configs Sahara will force
  down to 3-level.

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Reshetnyak <sreshetniak@mirantis.com>

Partially implements: blueprint vanilla-plugin-hadoop-2

Change-Id: If5b93dde1f6aaaf619def60634da8c8819a3c75a
(cherry picked from commit 066cc7b8b43075907cd293e304aa6a0e16b3a11c)

commit_message:
Updating the setup development environment docs for icehouse

Changes
* rewording title paragraph to be more descriptive of the document
* adding a link to devstack.org in the "... inside DevStack" section
* adding a sentence about developing on OSX to the "... inside DevStack"
section
* changing the toctree link to the OSX VM install doc to be inline
* minor grammar cleanup on section titles
* adding a header paragraph to the ui dev environ page
* rewording the "... as part of DevStack" section to be similar to dev
environ doc
* minor cleanups to ui dev environ page
* correcting sahara-dashboard location in /opt/stack

Partial-Implements: blueprint update-docs-icehouse

Change-Id: Ideed96512ee7f28280577f2520bacc620952e305
(cherry picked from commit a693dc0584851685885bdb572c1d0eb0a847a8e3)

commit_message:
Fix use of securitygroup/firewall_driver

As reported by Boon Lee, various parts of the documentation were referring
to 'security_group' instead of 'securitygroup'. Additionally, the section
was left out of one command to configure the firewall_driver.

http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/networking-options-securitygroups.html

Change-Id: I148f6a96064bd6fd31f9f6abaf6985881c337aa9
Closes-Bug: 1302945

Remove duplicate instance_usage_audit

puppet-ceilometer and puppet-nova due to change I9e10dfb2. Remove the
redundant definition from puppet-ceilometer.

the catalog_type parameter and offer finer control over
the catalog driver configuration in Keystone.

subject: Don't restart MySQL/Corosync on package changes
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7468, 'name': 'Sergey Vasilenko', 'email': 'svasilenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'xenolog'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9037, 'name': 'Dmitry Ilyin', 'email': 'idv1985@gmail.com', 'username': 'dilyin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-08 10:18:08.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/galera/manifests/init.pp', 'deployment/puppet/corosync/manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "Don't restart MySQL/Corosync on package changes

For now we shoud exclude MySQL/Corosync from Patching OS feature and do
not notify their services on package changes.
If they could be a subject of updates, then address
FIXME sessions appropriately.
Note: Other resources under the Pacemaker management (neutron agents,
heat engine) are still on the TODO list to ensure their gracefull
OCF-based restarting.

Change-Id: Ia662ed2ee29ee7fc99a6e57e0040aacfc12d998e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Don't restart MySQL/Corosync on package changes

For now we shoud exclude MySQL/Corosync from Patching OS feature and do
not notify their services on package changes.
If they could be a subject of updates, then address
FIXME sessions appropriately.
Note: Other resources under the Pacemaker management (neutron agents,
heat engine) are still on the TODO list to ensure their gracefull
OCF-based restarting.

Change-Id: Ia662ed2ee29ee7fc99a6e57e0040aacfc12d998e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
VMware: Fixes the instance resize problem

The fix includes separating out methods for
associating/disassociating a vsphere vm from the
openstack instance. Modifying the resize workflow
to use the above mentioned methods.

Closes-Bug: #1295381

Change-Id: I92acdd5cd00f739d504738413d3b63a2e17f2866
(cherry picked from commit 91ddf85abb8a516cfa2da346b393aa7234660f6c)

commit_message:
Fix small bugs

1) Query with select_type=COUNT  was fixed
2) data-load utils was optimized
3) cassandra execute query retry if connection closed implemented
4) index system fields order was fixed

subject: Do not allow HEAD images/detail
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-05 01:52:26.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v1/router.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/api/v1/images.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v1/test_api.py'], 'message': 'Do not allow HEAD images/detail

Currently, a HEAD images/detail request goes through the images/{id}
route which leads to a 500 response status.
This HEAD method should be handled separetely in order to return a
405 Method Not Allowed response and suggest GET as an allowed method.

Change-Id: Ic83e819189bcff7c4735af476217a9ed1e4f41b8
Closes-Bug: #1297358
'}]
commit_message:
Do not allow HEAD images/detail

Currently, a HEAD images/detail request goes through the images/{id}
route which leads to a 500 response status.
This HEAD method should be handled separetely in order to return a
405 Method Not Allowed response and suggest GET as an allowed method.

Change-Id: Ic83e819189bcff7c4735af476217a9ed1e4f41b8
Closes-Bug: #1297358

subject: Refactor the DB implementation of Capabilities API
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-07 14:06:31.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/base.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_mongodb.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_hbase.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_log.py', 'ceilometer/tests/storage/test_impl_db2.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_db2.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py', 'ceilometer/storage/pymongo_base.py'], 'message': 'Refactor the DB implementation of Capabilities API

Replace the update of DEFAULT_CAPABILITIES into the __init__ function in
the Connection class of base.py instead of the Connection class of each
DB driver.

The AVAILABLE_CAPABILITIES dict was divided into two case of MongoDB
and DB2 drivers, the common capabilities are listed in pymongo_base.py
in COMMON_AVAILABLE_CAPABILTIES, which is updated with the capabilities
dict of the two affected DB drivers using pymongo.

Change-Id: I244eabc64f985d5a7ab5e166c72bcdb88b7e3372
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor the DB implementation of Capabilities API

Replace the update of DEFAULT_CAPABILITIES into the __init__ function in
the Connection class of base.py instead of the Connection class of each
DB driver.

The AVAILABLE_CAPABILITIES dict was divided into two case of MongoDB
and DB2 drivers, the common capabilities are listed in pymongo_base.py
in COMMON_AVAILABLE_CAPABILTIES, which is updated with the capabilities
dict of the two affected DB drivers using pymongo.

Change-Id: I244eabc64f985d5a7ab5e166c72bcdb88b7e3372

commit_message:
add exit trap to determine what's failing

grenade does a lot with starting and stopping processes, so if
we get a hard to diagnose fail dump the process list and disk
status.

Change-Id: Ia7377608cdc51067bc418569012df9a81d48e060

subject: Add main developer page
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-01 21:04:19.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'test-requirements.txt', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add main developer page

This adds the main ('index') page for developers (to be available
at http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-ironicclient/).
It has minimal information, and is a place holder so that we can
start adding documentation.

This also fixes issues with 'python setup.py build_sphinx':
- was getting "error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name"
  because sphinx 1.2b3 was being installed instead of 1.1.2
  (see https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ci/+bug/1259511)
- was getting "sphinx.errors.ExtensionError: Could not import
  extension oslo.sphinx (exception: No module named sphinx)"
- was complaining about missing '_theme' (oslosphinx has the theme)

Change-Id: I47ad7e10c20b80a99ae36755b2f7f67c080676fd
Partial-Bug: #1300990
'}]
commit_message:
Add main developer page

This adds the main ('index') page for developers (to be available
at http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-ironicclient/).
It has minimal information, and is a place holder so that we can
start adding documentation.

This also fixes issues with 'python setup.py build_sphinx':
- was getting "error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name"
  because sphinx 1.2b3 was being installed instead of 1.1.2
  (see https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ci/+bug/1259511)
- was getting "sphinx.errors.ExtensionError: Could not import
  extension oslo.sphinx (exception: No module named sphinx)"
- was complaining about missing '_theme' (oslosphinx has the theme)

Change-Id: I47ad7e10c20b80a99ae36755b2f7f67c080676fd
Partial-Bug: #1300990

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-07 13:55:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py'], 'message': 'mark vif_driver as deprecated and log warning

Several classes were dropped from nova.virt.libvirt.vif from havana ->
icehouse, leading to invalid configurations if one of these classes was
used in the libvirt_vif_driver setting in nova.conf.  The error message
produced by nova-compute in this situation is misleading.

This patch introduces stubs for all of the classes that were removed.
These stubs inherit from LibvirtGenericVIFDriver and log a deprecation
warning in __init__.

This patch also marks the vif_driver option as deprecated.

Change-Id: I6d6cb9315ce6f3b33d17756bcdc77dccda26fefe
Closed-bug: 1302796
(cherry picked from commit 9f6070e194504cc2ca2b7f2a2aabbf91c6b81897)
'}]
commit_message:
mark vif_driver as deprecated and log warning

Several classes were dropped from nova.virt.libvirt.vif from havana ->
icehouse, leading to invalid configurations if one of these classes was
used in the libvirt_vif_driver setting in nova.conf.  The error message
produced by nova-compute in this situation is misleading.

This patch introduces stubs for all of the classes that were removed.
These stubs inherit from LibvirtGenericVIFDriver and log a deprecation
warning in __init__.

This patch also marks the vif_driver option as deprecated.

Change-Id: I6d6cb9315ce6f3b33d17756bcdc77dccda26fefe
Closed-bug: 1302796
(cherry picked from commit 9f6070e194504cc2ca2b7f2a2aabbf91c6b81897)

commit_message:
Use built-in print() instead of print statement

In python 3 print statement is not supported, so we should use
only print() functions.

Fixes bug 1226943

Change-Id: I721e67c917ba7018401ad40ef30081883dcec420

ML2 and Big Switch plugins was wrong and it should be
[securitygroup].

commit_message:
Port to Pecan/WSME for API v2

Routing either V1 or V2 using a Facade. By default, V1 is enabled
but can be deactivated by a confflag.

Pecan controller for Lease created using WSME i/o validation

Implements blueprint: pecan-wsme

Change-Id: I9047abece78632daa13fdebfea9fb8aaa3c60981

commit_message:
Catch exception during resolving outputs

Previously we got error when try to show incorrect outputs.
Now we catch all exceptions and return None value in this case.

Change-Id: I7a7c53c1ad8f42082c89c92cbcb52599a6c7f1f8
Closes-Bug: #1273490

commit_message:
fix grub2 installation on Debian Wheezy

--target has been introduced in grub2. This patch ensure we use
the minimal version before adding the --target XXX flag.

Debian Wheezy and Precise share the same limitation regarding the
root device.

Change-Id: I5b3ad42b9fb536d13fb65d84339bc15bc23d99a3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-31 21:18:20.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/v1/test_multiprocessing.py'], 'message': 'Fix deprecation warning in test_multiprocessing

tests/functional/v1/test_multiprocessing uses psutil to get a list of
processes. The Processor class now uses children() instead of
get_children(); update the test with the current call to eliminate
the deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I83a6bb72b5282d3ab2a3b8e338ee3dc8668d2d53

commit_message:
Fix deprecation warning in test_multiprocessing

tests/functional/v1/test_multiprocessing uses psutil to get a list of
processes. The Processor class now uses children() instead of
get_children(); update the test with the current call to eliminate
the deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I83a6bb72b5282d3ab2a3b8e338ee3dc8668d2d53

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-08 06:19:30.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_security_groups_rpc.py', 'neutron/agent/securitygroups_rpc.py'], 'message': 'Add L2 Agent side handling for non consistent security_group settings

Add setting of the firewall_driver to NoopDriver when firewall_driver is None and
add warning if driver combination is not valid.
Modify is_valid_driver_combination to verify default settings: enable_security_group (True) and firewall_driver (None).

Change-Id: I841f9cf96ac6ee2ad17a4e8908d6c8a96f368cca
Closes-Bug: #1296957
'}]
commit_message:
Add L2 Agent side handling for non consistent security_group settings

Add setting of the firewall_driver to NoopDriver when firewall_driver is None and
add warning if driver combination is not valid.
Modify is_valid_driver_combination to verify default settings: enable_security_group (True) and firewall_driver (None).

Change-Id: I841f9cf96ac6ee2ad17a4e8908d6c8a96f368cca
Closes-Bug: #1296957

commit_message:
Merged in murano-common

In attempt to reduce number of Murano repositories to a sane minumum Murano
community decided to merge in murano-common repo to projects dependent on it:
* murano-api
* murano-agent

We hope that we will completely get rid of this code in Juno.

Change-Id: Id203e62b040ddc2fe67399b2b487eaddca5f564f
Partially-Implements: blueprint repository-reorganization

commit_message:
Grunt task to remove unnecessary static files after compression

As we removed deletion of unnecessary files from iso build script
due to errors, many users were confused as they were trying to
change static files on a master node and there was no effect as
require.js compiles concatenates all the files into main.js. So we
decided to revive this functionality as a part of 'grunt build'

Change-Id: I227616153effcd7ded0ad6617773f46359443b4e

commit_message:
Cardinal interpolation error

-Seems like for the big numbers, d3 is interpolating
 data badly and it is creating loops in the chart.
 So quick fix is to switch to linear interpolation
 as default.
-Other interpolation can be set with settings.

Change-Id: I82c1514dce6034b3cbc7f95682356a08301482b7
Fixes-bug: #1295537
(cherry picked from commit 8bcc5e9703fa4db5e702685a584d2e91fbea7b4a)

commit_message:
Fix alarm metadata in new autoscaling template

The new autoscaling template used old implicit metadata for creating
alarm: the patch fixes that by properly passing a new value to both the
alarms and the servers.

Change-Id: Ia5d99dd08cf02954ce78ef661fbe9f627948f9db

subject: Ensure network interfaces are in requested order
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-07 13:12:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': 'Ensure network interfaces are in requested order

_build_network_info_model was iterating current_neutron_ports
instead of port_ids which contains ports in their correctly requested
order. Because of this the requested nic order was no longer being
perserved. This patch fixes this and also changes the order of ports
in test_build_network_info_model() so this case is tested.

Change-Id: Ia9e71364bca6cbc24ebc1c234e6a5af14f51cd62
Closes-bug: #1300325
(cherry picked from commit 721e7f939859fbfe6b0c79ef3a6d5e43c916da65)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure network interfaces are in requested order

_build_network_info_model was iterating current_neutron_ports
instead of port_ids which contains ports in their correctly requested
order. Because of this the requested nic order was no longer being
perserved. This patch fixes this and also changes the order of ports
in test_build_network_info_model() so this case is tested.

Change-Id: Ia9e71364bca6cbc24ebc1c234e6a5af14f51cd62
Closes-bug: #1300325
(cherry picked from commit 721e7f939859fbfe6b0c79ef3a6d5e43c916da65)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7109, 'name': 'Dmitry Mescheryakov (dmitryme)', 'email': 'dmescheryakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmitryme'}, {'_account_id': 7125, 'name': 'Alexander Ignatov', 'email': 'aignatov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aignatov'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7700, 'name': 'Nikolay Mahotkin', 'email': 'nikolay.makhotkin@gmail.com', 'username': 'nmakhotkin'}, {'_account_id': 8090, 'name': 'Chad Roberts', 'email': 'croberts@redhat.com', 'username': 'croberts'}, {'_account_id': 8091, 'name': 'Trevor McKay', 'email': 'tmckay@redhat.com', 'username': 'tmckay'}, {'_account_id': 8411, 'name': 'Andrew Lazarev', 'email': 'alazarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'alazarev'}, {'_account_id': 10670, 'name': 'Michael McCune', 'email': 'elmiko@redhat.com', 'username': 'mimccune'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-03 20:38:40.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/swift/swift_helper.py', 'sahara/conductor/resource.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/conductor/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Add a custom filter method to scan wrapped dict results

Basic filtering is available via Resource._filter_fields and
Resource._children but partial filtering of fields is not supported.

This change allows a Resource to define custom sanitization methods
for individual fields. The specified method is applied after the
field has been generated.

For nested structures, particularly when elements are not Resource
types, it is easier to scan the field after generation and remove
specific elements than it is to modify the recursive descent already
implemented in to_wrapped_dict().

JobExecutions are filtered with this mechanism to set swift credential
values to empty strings and to remove the 'conf' section reported
for running Oozie actions.

Closes-Bug: #1300291
Change-Id: Ifb0b99a3e13d40306139b0d0021aead69e870205
"}]
commit_message:
Add a custom filter method to scan wrapped dict results

Basic filtering is available via Resource._filter_fields and
Resource._children but partial filtering of fields is not supported.

This change allows a Resource to define custom sanitization methods
for individual fields. The specified method is applied after the
field has been generated.

For nested structures, particularly when elements are not Resource
types, it is easier to scan the field after generation and remove
specific elements than it is to modify the recursive descent already
implemented in to_wrapped_dict().

JobExecutions are filtered with this mechanism to set swift credential
values to empty strings and to remove the 'conf' section reported
for running Oozie actions.

Closes-Bug: #1300291
Change-Id: Ifb0b99a3e13d40306139b0d0021aead69e870205

commit_message:
Add required_parameters validator

With this validator we can validate required parameters for a given
benchmark by putting decorator like following:-
@valid.add_validator(valid.required_parameters([list of parameters])

Change-Id: I87a848d06f631da021a74b7ab3d970c3fe892115

commit_message:
Note that XML support *may* be removed.

To be more accurate, note that XML support *may* be removed as early
as the Juno release.  I think there is still more discussion needed
around concrete usage data before the removal date is finalized.

Related thread:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-April/031608.html

Closes-bug: #1301384
Change-Id: I0415b50ec0b81bb56f5c0fa13bc6d01f8bec7865
(cherry picked from commit 5d39189df6ecb559c3f8b7e2fa3beff25da9f452)

subject: Disable check_uptodate.sh check in pep8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-08 03:52:04.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Disable check_uptodate.sh check in pep8

Running generate_sample.sh currently produces an invalid heat.conf.sample
due to bug #1288586.

This change disables the check_uptodate.sh in the tox pep8 so that the
gate-heat-pep8 job passes while we find a more appropriate solution.

Change-Id: Ib20c4f892df68f7112d969d801a18a1a5bfbd474
Related-Bug: #1288586
'}]
commit_message:
Disable check_uptodate.sh check in pep8

Running generate_sample.sh currently produces an invalid heat.conf.sample
due to bug #1288586.

This change disables the check_uptodate.sh in the tox pep8 so that the
gate-heat-pep8 job passes while we find a more appropriate solution.

Change-Id: Ib20c4f892df68f7112d969d801a18a1a5bfbd474
Related-Bug: #1288586

commit_message:
Correct update to zero numbers of health monitors

If property 'monitors' is in prop_diff and equals to None ot [],
we should not skip dissociating step for monitors.

Change-Id: I313a8e09dbeeab78126ff889316f0ecb1a9a8c84
Closes-Bug: #1301406

subject: Remove __del__ usage in oslo.vmware driver
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-07 13:46:30.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/vmware/rw_handles.py', 'oslo/vmware/api.py', 'tests/test_rw_handles.py', 'tests/test_api.py'], 'message': 'Remove __del__ usage in oslo.vmware driver

The driver uses __del__ in which may cause spurious errors.
python docs detail the caveats of using __del__.

In order to enable the calling application to be able to close
existing sessions, a new method has been added: logout.
This will be used to terminate and logout of the existing session.

Change-Id: I94482b79cc451d027cb853a6d0775e4da189cb7e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove __del__ usage in oslo.vmware driver

The driver uses __del__ in which may cause spurious errors.
python docs detail the caveats of using __del__.

In order to enable the calling application to be able to close
existing sessions, a new method has been added: logout.
This will be used to terminate and logout of the existing session.

Change-Id: I94482b79cc451d027cb853a6d0775e4da189cb7e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-07 13:09:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: pause mode is not supported by all drivers

Only KVM/Qemu drivers support the VIR_DOMAIN_START_PAUSED flag
Booting guests on other drivers with the above flag will make it fail.

Closes-Bug: 1301453
Change-Id: Ia98e018b686c4ec3c15fd1f6bcc78188f330fcef
(cherry picked from commit bfb28fcf9031af4c695177663702ce05edbbfa4d)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: pause mode is not supported by all drivers

Only KVM/Qemu drivers support the VIR_DOMAIN_START_PAUSED flag
Booting guests on other drivers with the above flag will make it fail.

Closes-Bug: 1301453
Change-Id: Ia98e018b686c4ec3c15fd1f6bcc78188f330fcef
(cherry picked from commit bfb28fcf9031af4c695177663702ce05edbbfa4d)

This patch removes the root-passwd element from the list of elements
  in the HDP image generation process.
It was determined that having root-passwd included causes some problems on
  RHEL, and is also a potential security issue.
This patch modifies the default cause, such that root-passwd is not
  included in HDP images.  In order to support local debugging of
  generated images, this patch adds a "-d" (debug) flag that can be
  enabled in order to add root-passwd to the HDP images. If not
  specified, the debugging flag defaults to false (not
  including root-passwd).
This patch updates the usage log to explain the usage of the
  -d parameter.

Change-Id: I1692916a3d7c08b8a3b180913e6fca3547a2e2bc
'}]
commit_message:
Removes default usage of root-passwd element from HDP image generation

This patch removes the root-passwd element from the list of elements
  in the HDP image generation process.
It was determined that having root-passwd included causes some problems on
  RHEL, and is also a potential security issue.
This patch modifies the default cause, such that root-passwd is not
  included in HDP images.  In order to support local debugging of
  generated images, this patch adds a "-d" (debug) flag that can be
  enabled in order to add root-passwd to the HDP images. If not
  specified, the debugging flag defaults to false (not
  including root-passwd).
This patch updates the usage log to explain the usage of the
  -d parameter.

Change-Id: I1692916a3d7c08b8a3b180913e6fca3547a2e2bc

commit_message:
Tune sqlalchemy backend settings for OS on scale

- Tune SQLAlchemy backend settings for Openstack (QueuePool related)
- Evaluate sqlalchemy backend scaling parameters at osnailyfactor
- Fix deprecated in I [DEFAULT] usage for database config
- For Neutron use neutron_config[:database] as well
    * Ensure max_pool_size in [10, 30] limits (10 is config defaults)
    * Ensure max_overflow in [20, 60] limits (20 is config defaults)

Closes-bug: #1274784
Partial blueprint: optimize-db-performance-at-scale

Change-Id: I0e843022f04f53150da52858280034aad6aee987

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7125, 'name': 'Alexander Ignatov', 'email': 'aignatov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aignatov'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7555, 'name': 'Matthew Farrellee', 'email': 'matt@redhat.com', 'username': 'farrellee'}, {'_account_id': 8411, 'name': 'Andrew Lazarev', 'email': 'alazarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'alazarev'}, {'_account_id': 9499, 'name': 'Robert Nettleton', 'email': 'rnettleton@hortonworks.com', 'username': 'rnettleton'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-07 15:44:01.000000000', 'files': ['elements/hadoop-hdp/post-install.d/40-turn-off-gmetad'], 'message': 'Removes the service stop call for gmetad

This patch fixes bug 1302130.  The call to "gmetad stop" has been
  removed from the post-install.d/40-turn-off-gmetad script,  since
  this command will run on the host machine, rather than on the
  generated image.  Only the call the chkconfig to keep
  gmetad from starting is required to achieve the desired affect of
  keeping gmetad from starting upon image boot.

Fixes: bug # 1302130

Change-Id: I97a549be89212e19b84030f156ae9b175b113df4
'}]
commit_message:
Removes the service stop call for gmetad

This patch fixes bug 1302130.  The call to "gmetad stop" has been
  removed from the post-install.d/40-turn-off-gmetad script,  since
  this command will run on the host machine, rather than on the
  generated image.  Only the call the chkconfig to keep
  gmetad from starting is required to achieve the desired affect of
  keeping gmetad from starting upon image boot.

Fixes: bug # 1302130

Change-Id: I97a549be89212e19b84030f156ae9b175b113df4

commit_message:
Provide rootwrap configuration options

Our tools now generate tables for the rootwrap.conf files. Include this
tables in the config-reference guide. The cinder-rootwrap.xml file is
not used ATM, because our cinder documentation doesn't provide a config
overview (see bug #1304172).

Revert some help strings for nova to what they are in icehouse (the
previous run of the tool accidentally picked up the juno options).

Change-Id: Id3a76cc5ae29b7cf45118958520126ec8f75853d

commit_message:
Catching no handled exception on leases deletion

an image is not possible due to invalid vm_state.
Also, adding new test to cover the scenario being fixed.

commit_message:
Duplicated lease name should return HTTP 409

Added new manager exception 'LeaseNameAlreadyExists',
wraps db exception ClimateDBDuplicateEntry occures during lease creation
and returns in the API as:
HTTP 409 The lease with name: %(name)s already exists

Current implementation returns HTTP 500 Internal server error,
which is not user friendly.

Change-Id: I3ead720eda9b08980e3ee7c5cf878354b5455877
Closes-Bug: #1302584\

commit_message:
Removes volumes redefinition in fake nova_client

Reasons:
- The redefinition of nova_client.volumes was making it,
  nova_client.volumes.volumes, if we needed to call the volume APIs
  from nova_client.
- nova_client.volumes is already defined when defining "class FakeClient".

Changes:
- Removes redefinition of nova_client.volumes.

Change-Id: I5981d461e5a0fd000214c35d5d0be58d86d6d368
Closes-Bug: #1292457

commit_message:
Add save_admin_pass property to CloudServer

This adds a save_admin_pass property to indicate whether or not the
admin_pass should be persisted in heat.  save_admin_pass is False by
default.

Implements: blueprint custom-adminpass (partial)
Change-Id: Iac59056abf2cf709ecb940b84c56d09fa3fbb7d4

commit_message:
Add admin_pass as attribute to CloudServer

This stores the admin password returned by nova() as an encrypted
property on the CloudServer to allow template authors to display them
as outputs of a stack.

Co-Authored-By: Anderson Mesquita <andersonvom@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint custom-adminpass (partial)
Change-Id: Ic11f1ddcd114631b92f87d5760ab7a6761ba40e4

commit_message:
BigSwitch: Stop HTTP patch before overriding

Stops the default HTTPConnection patch used by the
Big Switch tests before patching HTTPConnection with
another substitution. This prevents mock from losing
track of the default patch which was resulting in it
not consistently being stopped by the stopall call in
cleanup.

This also corrects an incorrectly targeted mock for the
HTTP patch in one of the test files.

Closes-Bug: #1303605
Change-Id: Ia5b374c5f8d3a7905d915de4f1f8d4f3a6f0e58d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-17 22:30:44.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_attributes.py', 'neutron/api/v2/attributes.py'], 'message': "Fix _validate_mac_address method

The method _validate_mac_address previously used: netaddr.EUI(data)
which would convert data passed in to the correct mac_address representation.
For example if data=123 it would return: EUI('00-00-00-00-00-7B'). To fix
this issue I used netaddr.valid_mac() instead which returns a bool if a mac is
valid or not and does not raise. Note this file needs some improvements to
improve how exception handling is done that will come later.

Change-Id: I4fb868e40abbad9e743028cc768f47ca9b3e0e70
Closes-bug: 1291163
"}]
commit_message:
Fix _validate_mac_address method

The method _validate_mac_address previously used: netaddr.EUI(data)
which would convert data passed in to the correct mac_address representation.
For example if data=123 it would return: EUI('00-00-00-00-00-7B'). To fix
this issue I used netaddr.valid_mac() instead which returns a bool if a mac is
valid or not and does not raise. Note this file needs some improvements to
improve how exception handling is done that will come later.

Change-Id: I4fb868e40abbad9e743028cc768f47ca9b3e0e70
Closes-bug: 1291163

Fix wrong section name "security_group" in sample config files

The section name [security_group] in Sample config files of
ML2 and Big Switch plugins was wrong and it should be
[securitygroup].

Closes-Bug: #1304105

commit_message:
pci request mark interface

PCI request identify by uuid, request_id will be saved
into the pci device object while allocation. the device
then can be identify by this uuid.

Change-Id: Ic83f2cc080aa044a1e7b828c463c6e8f62483f47
Signed-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>

commit_message:
Enhance PCI alias to support pci flavor attr

Currently PCI alias can support only vendor_id/product_id as keys,
and we need enhance it to support all potential keys from pci_flavor_attrs.

Change-Id: I8a21cbd5582454cae8525426f268de4482287e0f
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
PCI: interface for populate metadata and filter

The network parser should convert the pci flavor in the --nic option
to pci request and save them into instance meta data.

The filter scheduler also should populate the request from metadata
for filter.

bp:pci-extra-info
Sined-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
Change-Id: I55cd6f411345faace26b6f416b5ba4298986303e

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-03-31 06:09:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/pci/pci_stats.py'], 'message': 'PCI stats group on demand

Control node has PCI flavors which allow the administrator to package up
PCI devices for users. Flavor has a name, and matching expression that
selects available (offered by white list) devices.

PCI flavor is defined by a set of (k,v), the k is the PCI property. Not
every PCI property is available to PCI flavor, only a specific set of PCI
property can used to define the PCI flavor, it's global to cloud. These
PCI properties are defined via a global configuration :

  pci_flavor_attrs = ["vendor_id", ...]

pci stats also report stats pool base on pci_flavor_attrs's attrs list.

bp:pci-extra-info
Sined-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
Change-Id: Iad4430a4f7461c7ac4a9fa5c76057db136831e4f
'}]
commit_message:
PCI stats group on demand

Control node has PCI flavors which allow the administrator to package up
PCI devices for users. Flavor has a name, and matching expression that
selects available (offered by white list) devices.

PCI flavor is defined by a set of (k,v), the k is the PCI property. Not
every PCI property is available to PCI flavor, only a specific set of PCI
property can used to define the PCI flavor, it's global to cloud. These
PCI properties are defined via a global configuration :

  pci_flavor_attrs = ["vendor_id", ...]

pci stats also report stats pool base on pci_flavor_attrs's attrs list.

bp:pci-extra-info
Sined-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
Change-Id: Iad4430a4f7461c7ac4a9fa5c76057db136831e4f

subject: Raise execution failure instead of type error
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-30 03:27:27.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/graph_action.py'], 'message': 'Raise execution failure instead of type error

On a request to schedule a unknown node type
raise a execution failure instead of a type
error to ensure that we throw a common set of
exceptions from the engine execution code. To
retain the cause of the execution failure set
the exception cause as the type error so that
this information is retained.

Breaking change: anyone catching type error will
have to switch to catching the more uniform engine
execution failure instead.

Change-Id: Ief27284512df8df549bfd84147ccc6d08f9ef728
'}]
commit_message:
Raise execution failure instead of type error

On a request to schedule a unknown node type
raise a execution failure instead of a type
error to ensure that we throw a common set of
exceptions from the engine execution code. To
retain the cause of the execution failure set
the exception cause as the type error so that
this information is retained.

Breaking change: anyone catching type error will
have to switch to catching the more uniform engine
execution failure instead.

Change-Id: Ief27284512df8df549bfd84147ccc6d08f9ef728

subject: Add jobboard tools
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-15 18:36:42.000000000', 'files': ['tools/run_zookeeper.sh', 'tools/board_example.py'], 'message': 'Add jobboard tools

- In order for people to easily try out
  the job and board concept with zookeeper (the
  current default impl) it is useful to have a
  simple example script that can be used to do
  this as part of the taskflow core tree (but not
  under the main code, but as a tool/example).
- Include a simple script to download & run zookeeper
  as well, so this process is not as hard for folks

Change-Id: I9a84c61134d92a5750b672176c61e20c98a53bcd
'}]
commit_message:
Add jobboard tools

- In order for people to easily try out
  the job and board concept with zookeeper (the
  current default impl) it is useful to have a
  simple example script that can be used to do
  this as part of the taskflow core tree (but not
  under the main code, but as a tool/example).
- Include a simple script to download & run zookeeper
  as well, so this process is not as hard for folks

Change-Id: I9a84c61134d92a5750b672176c61e20c98a53bcd

commit_message:
Work around the sqlite3 bug by using tempfiles

Instead of using in-memory backends with threaded
engines, since it appears sqlite does not correctly
handle or recommend multiple threads using the same
:in-memory: backend.

Closes-Bug: #1253673

Change-Id: I7a7ded414d8786f501ec705d132a4aa20e6ef1cb

subject: Mess around with eventlet
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-10-12 20:53:50.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/utils/eventlet_utils.py'], 'message': "Mess around with eventlet

Instead of keeping an active pool of greenthreads
'spinning' (greenthreads don't really spin) even
when the queue is empty spin up new greenthreads
as needed and when the queue is empty, let the
existing greenthreads exit cleanly.

Change-Id: Ifa75a35ffe678dcd93bb723e6ae572b75fc550d1
"}]
commit_message:
Mess around with eventlet

Instead of keeping an active pool of greenthreads
'spinning' (greenthreads don't really spin) even
when the queue is empty spin up new greenthreads
as needed and when the queue is empty, let the
existing greenthreads exit cleanly.

Change-Id: Ifa75a35ffe678dcd93bb723e6ae572b75fc550d1

commit_message:
Add the start of a item registry

A item registry is useful to be able to easily
and centrally register tasks/flows (or other
things that have a uuid property) for others
to use (or find based on a known set of
attributes).

Change-Id: I99b96dcfef0edb826d19f71848f06e50f8457711

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7494, 'name': 'Guangya Liu', 'email': 'gyliu513@gmail.com', 'username': 'JayLau'}, {'_account_id': 7575, 'name': 'Sabari', 'email': 'smurugesan@vmware.com', 'username': 'sabari'}, {'_account_id': 7677, 'name': 'Solly Ross', 'email': 'sross@redhat.com', 'username': 'sross'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-31 08:56:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conductor/tasks/live_migrate.py'], 'message': 'VMWare: Enable live migration with one nova compute (WIP)

Currently with VMWare VCDriver, one nova compute can manage multiple
cluster/RP, this caused cluster admin cannot do live migration between
clusters/PRs if those clusters/PRs managed by one nova compute.

The fix was trying to do the following to enable live migration with
one nova compute:
1) When live migration check if host are same, check both host and
node for the VM instance.
2) When nova scheduler select destination for live migration, the live
migration task should put (host, node) to attempted hosts.
3) Nova scheduler needs to be enhanced to support ignored_nodes.

Change-Id: I06a20dba22932d81d43b67f99817748f450d04bb
Partial-Bug: #1192192
'}]
commit_message:
VMWare: Enable live migration with one nova compute (WIP)

Currently with VMWare VCDriver, one nova compute can manage multiple
cluster/RP, this caused cluster admin cannot do live migration between
clusters/PRs if those clusters/PRs managed by one nova compute.

The fix was trying to do the following to enable live migration with
one nova compute:
1) When live migration check if host are same, check both host and
node for the VM instance.
2) When nova scheduler select destination for live migration, the live
migration task should put (host, node) to attempted hosts.
3) Nova scheduler needs to be enhanced to support ignored_nodes.

Change-Id: I06a20dba22932d81d43b67f99817748f450d04bb
Partial-Bug: #1192192

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2014-03-31 14:02:56.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'setup.sh', 'muranodashboard/settings.py', 'muranodashboard/local/settings_epilogue.py', 'muranodashboard/local/settings_prologue.py', 'muranodashboard/wsgi/django.wsgi'], 'message': "Separate muranodashboard.settings from openstack_dashboard.settings

The idea is to specify muranodashboard.settings as
DJANGO_SETTIGNS_MODULE in apache config/ WSGI wrapper, then import
openstack_dashboard.settings from muranodashboard.settings. Thus we
touch neither openstack_dashboard.settings (which is vanilla
openstack_dashboard settings), nor local.local_settings (which is
openstack_dashboard customization module for admins).

Furthermore, all muranodashboard settings which are really could be
modified (directories, different modes specified in settings) are
moved out to a separate file similar to local.local_settings. Sadly,
there have to be 2 such files, because of DATABASES &
openstack_dashboard.policy issue. First specifies actual DATABASES
(before statement 'from openstack_dashboard import policy' is
executed), second specifies all the rest parameters.

All required changes in apache config are made by setup.sh script.

Closes-Bug: #1267737
Change-Id: I455efeb5ee7825ac69eba2d1a3f4aefcef3dda81
"}]
commit_message:
Separate muranodashboard.settings from openstack_dashboard.settings

The idea is to specify muranodashboard.settings as
DJANGO_SETTIGNS_MODULE in apache config/ WSGI wrapper, then import
openstack_dashboard.settings from muranodashboard.settings. Thus we
touch neither openstack_dashboard.settings (which is vanilla
openstack_dashboard settings), nor local.local_settings (which is
openstack_dashboard customization module for admins).

Furthermore, all muranodashboard settings which are really could be
modified (directories, different modes specified in settings) are
moved out to a separate file similar to local.local_settings. Sadly,
there have to be 2 such files, because of DATABASES &
openstack_dashboard.policy issue. First specifies actual DATABASES
(before statement 'from openstack_dashboard import policy' is
executed), second specifies all the rest parameters.

All required changes in apache config are made by setup.sh script.

Closes-Bug: #1267737
Change-Id: I455efeb5ee7825ac69eba2d1a3f4aefcef3dda81

commit_message:
Introduce Hitachi Block Storage Driver

Introduce Hitachi Block Storage Driver for Hitachi VSP, HUS-VM and HUS arrays
with Fibre Channel and iSCSI.

This will support all features required in Icehouse:
* Volume Create/Delete
* Volume Attach/Detach
* Snapshot Create/Delete
* Create Volume from Snapshot
* Copy Image to Volume
* Copy Volume to Image
* Clone Volume
* Extend Volume

Implements: blueprint hitachi-block-storage-driver

Change-Id: I110e4d821e30ee8b140e3c83654b039ce3ce0fc9
Signed-off-by: Seiji Aguchi <seiji.aguchi.tr@hitachi.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-03-31 06:09:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/pci/pci_whitelist.py', 'nova/tests/pci/test_pci_whitelist.py'], 'message': "PCI whitelist support pci_infomation

'pci-information' combine the whitelist and extra infomation.

Pci-information can be define multiple times like
pci_information = [{pci-regex}, {pci-extra-attrs}], where
pci-regex is a dict of { string-key: string-value } pairs,
it can only match device properties, like vendor_id, address,
product_id, etc.
Pci-extra-attrs is a dict of {string-key:string-value} pairs.
The values can be arbitrary. All the extra attrs will be store
in the pci device table's extra info field.

whitelist is deprecated.

bp:pci-extra-info
Sined-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ida2911ebe14cfb03362dbb8e06aaf35f590f2c28
"}]
commit_message:
PCI whitelist support pci_infomation

'pci-information' combine the whitelist and extra infomation.

Pci-information can be define multiple times like
pci_information = [{pci-regex}, {pci-extra-attrs}], where
pci-regex is a dict of { string-key: string-value } pairs,
it can only match device properties, like vendor_id, address,
product_id, etc.
Pci-extra-attrs is a dict of {string-key:string-value} pairs.
The values can be arbitrary. All the extra attrs will be store
in the pci device table's extra info field.

whitelist is deprecated.

bp:pci-extra-info
Sined-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ida2911ebe14cfb03362dbb8e06aaf35f590f2c28

subject: VMware: Use server-side views to retrieve objects
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-27 04:24:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vim_util.py'], 'message': "VMware: Use server-side views to retrieve objects

Repeatedly queried inventory objects can be retrieved efficiently
using server-side views. These views are stored in the server and
are constantly refreshed. This patch adds a helper method to the
VMware driver utility.

Operations like retrieving list of VM's, list of host's managed by
a cluster can be refactored to use this helper utility, and make a
single api call to retrieve objects.

WIP: Adding tests
implements blueprint vmware-use-views

Change-Id: I65ba24a9d2254727cfd5c836a7becb0325e40b98
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Use server-side views to retrieve objects

Repeatedly queried inventory objects can be retrieved efficiently
using server-side views. These views are stored in the server and
are constantly refreshed. This patch adds a helper method to the
VMware driver utility.

Operations like retrieving list of VM's, list of host's managed by
a cluster can be refactored to use this helper utility, and make a
single api call to retrieve objects.

WIP: Adding tests
implements blueprint vmware-use-views

Change-Id: I65ba24a9d2254727cfd5c836a7becb0325e40b98

commit_message:
Add migration to fix nullable params

In some tables nullable param for column doesn't correspond to one
declared in model. This migration syncronizes nullable params in
db and in models for following tables and columns:

- pci_devices (deleted, dev_type, product_id, vendor_id)
- quota_usages (resource)

Implements blueprint db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: Iaefafa9344d1ef72ac43b8495d0ebdebcdaa7e28

commit_message:
Add a migration to change index in 'migrations' table.

Index 'migrations_instance_uuid_and_status_idx' in db is not the same
as its description in models.py.

This migration remove 'deleted' column from this index, so
'migrations_instance_uuid_and_status_idx' in db would corresponds
with one defined in model.

Implements bp db-sync-models-with-migrations

Some indexes were skipped in model, but are present in db, because they are creating
by migrations. This indexes are:

To sync models with migrations we add this indexes to models.py.

Migration 216 creates this indexes on columns 'user_id' and 'deleted' for tables

commit_message:
Sync model with migrations

Some indexes were skipped in model, but are present in db, because they are creating
by migrations. This indexes are:
- ix_quota_usages_user_id_deleted
- ix_reservations_user_id_deleted

To sync models with migrations we add this indexes to models.py.

Migration 216 creates this indexes on columns 'user_id' and 'deleted' for tables
'quota_usages' and 'reservations'. But 'deleted' column doesn't need to be
indexed because of low cardinality of values. So in addition we add migration
to remove column 'deleted' from indexes 'ix_quota_usages_user_id_deleted' and
'ix_reservations_user_id_deleted' and change name of this indexes to
'ix_quota_usages_user_id' and 'ix_reservations_user_id'.

Implements bp db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I56d0e49520ea88b18d864dea0d2ce83a6d9e2bc1

commit_message:
Support expression to match PCI device property

The minimal regular expressions are rules to match PCI device properties
expressed as followed:
  * wildcard '*'  and number range like'[1-3]' is supported
  * PCI address support range like "0000:03-a5:12.1-3:"
  * OR operation must be used alone: (string1|string2)
peration
  *support compared to string, or sting compare to string

bp:pci-extra-info

Change-Id: I081dfe5a1ad392676a1e86a545ff8adf710f3541
Sined-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
