"}]
commit_message:
Use mox in test_get_domain_info_with_more_return

This test is causing XML parse failures due to the existing creation
of a virDomain with an xml argument of None (I couldn't find a system
this did work on ... maybe different versions of lxml handle None
arguments to etree.fromstring differently?).

Most of all of the other tests here seem to use mox, so convert this
to fix the problem and make it more like everything else (somewhat
suggested by comments in [1]).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85452/

Change-Id: Iee9d04ee0dca24675bf80f189165852283bfd444
Closes-bug: #1301602

subject: Check attributes of get server password Nova APIs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-02 06:43:01.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/compute/json/servers_client.py', 'tempest/services/compute/v3/json/servers_client.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/servers.py'], 'message': 'Check attributes of get server password Nova APIs

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova V2 & V3 get server password
APIs response and validate the response with added JSON schema
to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of get password V2 & V3 APIs is same and given below:

{
    "password": "%(encrypted_password)s"
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Iaec82632fd377435cdb10f8ac2e40c4fbd9f98f2
'}]
commit_message:
Check attributes of get server password Nova APIs

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova V2 & V3 get server password
APIs response and validate the response with added JSON schema
to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of get password V2 & V3 APIs is same and given below:

{
    "password": "%(encrypted_password)s"
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Iaec82632fd377435cdb10f8ac2e40c4fbd9f98f2

commit_message:
Move Storage Policy validation from parser to class

Currently we validate Storage Policy conflicts while parsing
swift.conf in parse_storage_policies. This let's us get away
with unnatural things in tests like patch_policies with two
policies that have the same name.

Additionally this change makes the rules a bit easier to
identify and assure coverage.

Change-Id: I6cd48e5a3b3658e106ecd20df0b04fd804c028a4
Implements: blueprint storage-policies

commit_message:
Changes Volume Prefix From mysql To datastore

changes the volume name from mysql-<uuid> to datastore-<uuid>. now
that multiple datastore types are supported, the volume name prefix
should not be hardcoded to "mysql-" so as to avoid confusion to the
user and/or cloud administrator.

Change-Id: Ib585eab42f609095dee709b6e6e5eb980eff42af
Closes-Bug: #1277401

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2014-04-07 07:00:39.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/volume.py', 'heat/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Add handle_update to VolumeAttachment

Updates for volume attachments were handled in UpdateReplace manner,
which fails when in need to attach new volume to the same mount
(or attach the same volume to different mount on the same server,
or attaching the same volume to different server).

This patch makes all properties of VolumeAttachment
to be update_allowed, adds necessary handle_update logic
and fixes VolumeDetachTask to reliably detach old volume
so that new one can be immediately attached.

Closes-Bug: #1269686
Closes-Bug: #1251439
Change-Id: I0aee64036bf8125f76e7f427716412a326ff5eef
'}]
commit_message:
Add handle_update to VolumeAttachment

Updates for volume attachments were handled in UpdateReplace manner,
which fails when in need to attach new volume to the same mount
(or attach the same volume to different mount on the same server,
or attaching the same volume to different server).

This patch makes all properties of VolumeAttachment
to be update_allowed, adds necessary handle_update logic
and fixes VolumeDetachTask to reliably detach old volume
so that new one can be immediately attached.

Closes-Bug: #1269686
Closes-Bug: #1251439
Change-Id: I0aee64036bf8125f76e7f427716412a326ff5eef

commit_message:
Ensure outputs are resolved for adopted stacks

The resolution of outputs is only performed for stacks in certain
states, so we need to add ADOPT to the valid list of actions,
as after a stack is ADOPT COMPLETE, it should be possible to resolve
the outputs in the same way as after create.

Change-Id: Iec7c9fe7cf48d7c87a5466b351ff04328d567e60
Closes-Bug: #1299173

commit_message:
Fix the parameter order of assertEqual in glanceclient v1 test

On assertEqual, the order of parameters should be (expected, observed).
But, some part of glanceclient v1 test were written with invalid order.
This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: If361309041a257c56bfc1fbbccf1b905839b0c18
Partially-bug: #1277104

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2455, 'name': 'Tihomir Trifonov', 'email': 't.trifonov@gmail.com', 'username': 'ttrifonov'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 4978, 'name': 'Julie Pichon', 'email': 'jpichon@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpichon'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2014-04-07 17:39:10.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v1_1/client.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_http.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_client.py', 'novaclient/v3/client.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_auth_plugins.py', 'novaclient/client.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_auth.py'], 'message': "Fix session handling in novaclient

Prior to this patch, novaclient was handling sessions in an inconsistent
manner.

Every time we created a client instance, it would use a global
connection pool, which made it difficult to use in a process that is
meant to be forked.

Obviously sessions like the ones provided by the requests library that
will automatically cause connections to be kept alive should not be
implicit. This patch moves the novaclient back to the age of a single
session-less request call by default, but also adds two more
resource-reuse friendly options that a user needs to be explicit about.

The first one is that both v1_1 and v3 clients can now be used as
context managers,. where the session will be kept open (and thus the
connection kept-alive) for the duration of the with block. This is far
more ideal for a web worker use-case as the session can be made
request-long.

The second one is the per-instance session. This is very similar to what
we had up until now, except it is not a global object so forking is
possible as long as each child instantiates it's own client. The session
once created will be kept open for the duration of the client object
lifetime.

Please note: client instances are not thread safe. As can be seen from
above forking example - if you wish to use threading/multiprocessing,
you *must not* share client instances.

DocImpact

Related-bug: #1247056
Closes-Bug: #1297796
Co-authored-by: Nikola Dipanov <ndipanov@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id59e48f61bb3f3c6223302355c849e1e99673410
"}]
commit_message:
Fix session handling in novaclient

Prior to this patch, novaclient was handling sessions in an inconsistent
manner.

Every time we created a client instance, it would use a global
connection pool, which made it difficult to use in a process that is
meant to be forked.

Obviously sessions like the ones provided by the requests library that
will automatically cause connections to be kept alive should not be
implicit. This patch moves the novaclient back to the age of a single
session-less request call by default, but also adds two more
resource-reuse friendly options that a user needs to be explicit about.

The first one is that both v1_1 and v3 clients can now be used as
context managers,. where the session will be kept open (and thus the
connection kept-alive) for the duration of the with block. This is far
more ideal for a web worker use-case as the session can be made
request-long.

The second one is the per-instance session. This is very similar to what
we had up until now, except it is not a global object so forking is
possible as long as each child instantiates it's own client. The session
once created will be kept open for the duration of the client object
lifetime.

Please note: client instances are not thread safe. As can be seen from
above forking example - if you wish to use threading/multiprocessing,
you *must not* share client instances.

DocImpact

Related-bug: #1247056
Closes-Bug: #1297796
Co-authored-by: Nikola Dipanov <ndipanov@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id59e48f61bb3f3c6223302355c849e1e99673410

commit_message:
Use glance as a backend for Solum LanguagePack API (GET Method)

Replace the implementation of GET method of LanguagePack API.
A GET on LanguagePack will query glance with the id provided and
retrieve LP attributes from Glance image tags.

This patch also deactivate functionnal tests for LP. They will be
enabled again when the LP API has been fully moved to "Glance".

Fixes bug 1301440

Change-Id: Ied7942da32577eca883d29b06c60a8f0da18e0d5

commit_message:
Dissociate LanguagePack and Service objects

To implements bp/store-language-packs-in-glance LP first need to be
standalone objects and not be tied to service.

This patch removes the link between a LanguagePack and its service,
making things much simpler.

It's a first start toward having LP fully into glance

Fixes bug 1301426

Change-Id: Ia7920d288a99dfda8f22a8e987d2ac53197b7e2a

Add glance client to solum

tags to filter them.

Fixes bug 1301427

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-14 11:08:47.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_gettext.py', 'openstack/common/gettextutils.py', 'tests/unit/fakes.py'], 'message': "Fix test_gettextutils on Python 3

On Python 3, str(obj) calls obj.__str__(), not obj.__unicode__().

The test does not pass with nosetests, LogLevelTranslationsTest fails with an
AttributeError (self.level is missing), because nosetests doesn't play well
with test scenarios.

Change-Id: I78ae106e336480d9995ac4394197ea45b8ef9b07
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test_gettextutils on Python 3

On Python 3, str(obj) calls obj.__str__(), not obj.__unicode__().

The test does not pass with nosetests, LogLevelTranslationsTest fails with an
AttributeError (self.level is missing), because nosetests doesn't play well
with test scenarios.

Change-Id: I78ae106e336480d9995ac4394197ea45b8ef9b07

subject: Support building wheels (PEP-427)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-07 10:32:39.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Support building wheels (PEP-427)

Universal is used to identify pure-Python module(by bdist_wheel). For
these, it is sufficient to build a wheel with _any_ Python ABI version
and publish that to PyPI (by whatever means).

Change-Id: I3aed7c0b74dd64264a92f577985f8d51ebe5f96d
'}]
commit_message:
Support building wheels (PEP-427)

Universal is used to identify pure-Python module(by bdist_wheel). For
these, it is sufficient to build a wheel with _any_ Python ABI version
and publish that to PyPI (by whatever means).

Change-Id: I3aed7c0b74dd64264a92f577985f8d51ebe5f96d

commit_message:
Missing baremetal driver API test

As a part of blueprint, this patch implements following API test -
Driver APIs -
1. Retrieve a list of drivers.

'fake' driver is created by default during ironic installation.
For this please have a look on -
https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/setup.cfg#L33

part of blueprint: missing-baremetal-api-test

Change-Id: I5abe62f2fb9aec103ce4e127a28f488ef1f342df

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-28 19:01:30.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'heatclient/tests/var/adopt_stack_data_empty.json', 'heatclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Raise error for zero-length adopt-file

Currently we ignore an invalid zero length adopt data file, which
results in a create happening instead.  This is probably not what
the user expects, so check and raise an error if the data file is
empty.

Change-Id: I17065fe90dfce8bf2941b577255d4e1930321a8f
Closes-Bug: #1299161
'}]
commit_message:
Raise error for zero-length adopt-file

Currently we ignore an invalid zero length adopt data file, which
results in a create happening instead.  This is probably not what
the user expects, so check and raise an error if the data file is
empty.

Change-Id: I17065fe90dfce8bf2941b577255d4e1930321a8f
Closes-Bug: #1299161

commit_message:
Compatibility fixes for Python 3.3

1) Added a py33 environment to tox
2) Updated tests to mock the correctly named builtins.open based on
python version
3) Other minor compatibility fixes

Tests for Python 3.3 will not pass due to this bug:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/83 among possibly others in
eventlet.

Change-Id: Ie4b512a926fa690ee77a71a89851c871ea1f6be0

commit_message:
Fix ironic api and conductor logging

The current elements for Ironic's Api and Conductor register the service with
options that override the conf files log setting. this patch removes the
bad options allowing logging to work as expected.

Change-Id: I81fb5cafbd7456e53bc3306b72bcaa675f9adffa

commit_message:
support multiple image formats and enable docker driver

this patch allows you to set the image format in config
file and then use either docker or qcow.

There are a few oustanding patches for novadocker driver
but I have it working from my fork which can be used from
https://github.com/rackerlabs/vagrant-solum-dev/tree/docker_driver

Change-Id: Ia8ad6519efa0e0c3a32a787a7ef78895110871f9

commit_message:
Adds commands for verification results

Command `rally verify list` displays list of verifications
Command `rally verify results` prints raw tests results
Command `rally verify show` prints verification results.
Command `rally verify detailed` prints verification results
with traceback of failed tests.

Blueprint tempest-verification

Change-Id: I19991219c2f184c5158fecc0d234c7a40031e092

commit_message:
Adds saver for results from `rally verify`

Better integration with tempest can be achieved by analyzing output
of testr. This patch provides parsing testr output and saves results
into database.

Blueprint tempest-verification
Closes-Bug: #1302475

Change-Id: I110bc115bd597df54499ac295d836a87411c4c80

The start method will be where any background threads will be started
in the plugin.  This will ensure that they start after forking worker
processes.

commit_message:
Add a start method to plugin and call it after forking processes

The start method will be where any background threads will be started
in the plugin.  This will ensure that they start after forking worker
processes.

The two types of worker processes that load the plugin are API and
RPC.  Both will now call start on the plugin after forking processes.

Change-Id: I461bf7642b6f5cbda0fb1e65fe019f9f091494da
Closes-Bug: #1301035

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-02 22:00:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Delete routers that are requested but not reported as active

There are two cases that I can think of that result in a router being
requested but not reported as active.  One is that admin_state_up has
been set to False.  In this case, the router is never removed and
continues to be operational.

The other case is if a router is changed and then deleted before the
change is processed.  In this case, it is prudent to be sure that the
router is queued for deletion.

Change-Id: I4738f599a18f0d130cc8ad4d4dafc488eec75ffd
Closes-Bug: #1215387
'}]
commit_message:
Delete routers that are requested but not reported as active

There are two cases that I can think of that result in a router being
requested but not reported as active.  One is that admin_state_up has
been set to False.  In this case, the router is never removed and
continues to be operational.

The other case is if a router is changed and then deleted before the
change is processed.  In this case, it is prudent to be sure that the
router is queued for deletion.

Change-Id: I4738f599a18f0d130cc8ad4d4dafc488eec75ffd
Closes-Bug: #1215387

subject: Update the keyring dependency
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-12 01:22:31.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Update the keyring dependency

Keyring is now at version 3.6 so it seems like
we should be ok moving to a newer version and
removing the need to continue supporting the
older versions.

Also the existing requirement doesn't seem to
make logical sense. It doesn't seem that this
restriction '>=1.6.1,<2.0,>=2.1' should ever
match anything.

Change-Id: I711092bfab97190de635a099fb0e771a22e90197
"}]
commit_message:
Update the keyring dependency

Keyring is now at version 3.6 so it seems like
we should be ok moving to a newer version and
removing the need to continue supporting the
older versions.

Also the existing requirement doesn't seem to
make logical sense. It doesn't seem that this
restriction '>=1.6.1,<2.0,>=2.1' should ever
match anything.

Change-Id: I711092bfab97190de635a099fb0e771a22e90197

commit_message:
Delete unused 'virt_type' key from nodes list.

This key was added but not documented, and then superseded by the
pm_type parameter (for Ironic which supports heterogeneous drivers).

Remove it to avoid confusion.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-03 16:09:20.000000000', 'files': ['swift-storage-source.yaml'], 'message': 'Add enable_tunneling to swift storage metadata

Add the enable_tunneling option to the neutron-openvswitch-agent
metadata for the swift storage template. If not preset, this option is
left blank in the openvswitch plugin configuration plugin. This causes

Change-Id: Ieadcdab295913121bd00dbd25e4245024bc2240f
'}]
commit_message:
Add enable_tunneling to swift storage metadata

Add the enable_tunneling option to the neutron-openvswitch-agent
metadata for the swift storage template. If not preset, this option is
left blank in the openvswitch plugin configuration plugin. This causes
the service to fail to start because a blank value is not permissible
for a boolean option.

Change-Id: Ieadcdab295913121bd00dbd25e4245024bc2240f

subject: Add BlockStorage0Config Resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-27 15:04:49.000000000', 'files': ['block-storage.yaml'], 'message': 'Add BlockStorage0Config Resource

Add a BlockStorage0Config resource in the block-storage.yaml template.
This was missing previously and was causing the behavior of having all
block storage nodes only being created after all other nodes were up in
a deployment (I presume b/c of the wait conditions).

Also, we need the BlockStorage0Config resource so that we can get the
configuration of neutron-openvswitch-agent from the metadata, previously
the values in the file were unset, causing the service to fail to start.

Change-Id: I297de24079d1ece66d35213b4ef1f2c8c50e73f0
'}]
commit_message:
Add BlockStorage0Config Resource

Add a BlockStorage0Config resource in the block-storage.yaml template.
This was missing previously and was causing the behavior of having all
block storage nodes only being created after all other nodes were up in
a deployment (I presume b/c of the wait conditions).

Also, we need the BlockStorage0Config resource so that we can get the
configuration of neutron-openvswitch-agent from the metadata, previously
the values in the file were unset, causing the service to fail to start.

Change-Id: I297de24079d1ece66d35213b4ef1f2c8c50e73f0

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to also run nova tests

This updates testr.conf to allow passing of the tests directory as an
environment variable (defaulting to ironic/tests/). Also updates tox.ini
to run testr once for ironic/tests and once for ironic/nova/tests/, then
combine subunit output.

test-requirements.txt is updated to pull in Nova from a tarball, as well
as mox and python-ironicclient.

Updates the existing Nova driver unit tests to account for recent
refactoring and changes in the Nova virt API.

Change-Id: Ibefa2e0d3f97512f4da9ace780703fe47467232e
Closes-bug: #1299312

subject: Show maintenance field in GET /nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-02 10:18:54.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/api/v1/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py'], 'message': "Show maintenance field in GET /nodes

Before the maintenance field was only shown if client issued a GET on
a specific node (node-show), but this is an important attribute to have
listed in a GET /nodes (node-list), it's a good info to know which nodes
from that list are in maintenance mode or not, and the Nova Ironic Driver
also need this information to determine which nodes are available to be
exposed to Nova or not.

Change-Id: Icc31a312130a1c2d5853da64bd9091a93221363c
"}]
commit_message:
Show maintenance field in GET /nodes

Before the maintenance field was only shown if client issued a GET on
a specific node (node-show), but this is an important attribute to have
listed in a GET /nodes (node-list), it's a good info to know which nodes
from that list are in maintenance mode or not, and the Nova Ironic Driver
also need this information to determine which nodes are available to be
exposed to Nova or not.

Change-Id: Icc31a312130a1c2d5853da64bd9091a93221363c

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-03-20 21:26:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/pci/pci_manager.py', 'nova/tests/pci/test_pci_manager.py'], 'message': 'Remove PciDeviceList usage in pci manager

Pci manager keeps a PciDeviceList and even try to append
object to the list. This is not correct, as the ObjectList
is designed as immutable, although the objects in the list is
mutable. We should simply use a list to keep devices.

Closes-Bug: #1273803

Change-Id: Ie80b6f5f47a1d2d2e20aadb4779be142c17b5b38
'}]
commit_message:
Remove PciDeviceList usage in pci manager

Pci manager keeps a PciDeviceList and even try to append
object to the list. This is not correct, as the ObjectList
is designed as immutable, although the objects in the list is
mutable. We should simply use a list to keep devices.

Closes-Bug: #1273803

commit_message:
Prevent creation of http images with invalid URIs

Active images should always be ready to be downloaded, regardless
they're locally or remotely stored.  This patch prevents images with
invalid location URIs from being created and entering the 'active'
state with no data.  This is only for the HTTP store.

Change-Id: Iec7a0457ffb3f937a058ad7c85b01179960a6d49
Partial-Bug: #1257273

subject: Print adminPass when rebuilding from shell
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-04 20:20:52.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/v1_1/fakes.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py', 'novaclient/v3/shell.py'], 'message': "Print adminPass when rebuilding from shell

The 'nova rebuild' command did not print the adminPass returned by the
server. This is because it discards the instance information returned
by the rebuild action and fetchs the information again. This would lose
the adminPass and it would not be printed for the user.

This patch reuses the instance information returned by the rebuild action
which ensures that the adminPass is printed by the shell.

Change-Id: I144bfa298bef529c78ca04042cd37a763537f09e
Closes-bug: 1302696
"}]
commit_message:
Print adminPass when rebuilding from shell

The 'nova rebuild' command did not print the adminPass returned by the
server. This is because it discards the instance information returned
by the rebuild action and fetchs the information again. This would lose
the adminPass and it would not be printed for the user.

This patch reuses the instance information returned by the rebuild action
which ensures that the adminPass is printed by the shell.

Change-Id: I144bfa298bef529c78ca04042cd37a763537f09e
Closes-bug: 1302696

commit_message:
Cold Migration: pass dest nodename to virt driver

Currently, the compute manager only specifies the destination
host_ip in the migration request to the virt driver. If a driver
supports multi compute-nodes, it may need to know the destination
nodename managed by the service.

This information is already available in the migration object,
but not passed on to the virt layer.

Partial-bug: #1270332

Change-Id: I4204c580866c87711fb52924a051846ea85f0055

subject: Fix invalid LDAP filter for user ID with comma
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-04 19:34:07.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/backends/ldap.py'], 'message': "Fix invalid LDAP filter for user ID with comma

The Keystone server would respond with a 500 error when configured
to use the LDAP identity backend and a request is made to get a
token for a user that has an ID with a comma. The response is like:

 Authorization Failed: An unexpected error prevented the server from
 fulfilling your request. {'desc': 'Bad search filter'} (HTTP 500)

This is because the user DN wasn't properly escaped in the filter
for the query to get the groups that the user is a member of.

Closes-Bug: #1302106

Change-Id: Ib4886e66af0e979fcf23a84bcd51b07034547cb9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid LDAP filter for user ID with comma

The Keystone server would respond with a 500 error when configured
to use the LDAP identity backend and a request is made to get a
token for a user that has an ID with a comma. The response is like:

 Authorization Failed: An unexpected error prevented the server from
 fulfilling your request. {'desc': 'Bad search filter'} (HTTP 500)

This is because the user DN wasn't properly escaped in the filter
for the query to get the groups that the user is a member of.

Closes-Bug: #1302106

Change-Id: Ib4886e66af0e979fcf23a84bcd51b07034547cb9

commit_message:
Removed possibility to run job w/o Oozie

* Added a validation function which checks if cluster contains oozie
  service in its node groups
* Added unit-test covers both valid and invalid cases when cluster
  contains and doesn't oozie service in attempt of job execution
* Fixed small issue in unit tests in validation utils where pathced
  api.get_cluster function had never been unpatched.

Change-Id: I5c5de6cfb1812ff6795797df63b8ec0292395fd1
Closes-Bug: #1291649

subject: Add histogram to the report of tasks' results
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-04-07 10:53:18.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/processing/charts/__init__.py', 'rally/benchmark/processing/src/index.mako', 'rally/benchmark/processing/charts/histogram.py', 'tests/benchmark/processing/test_plot.py', 'rally/benchmark/processing/plot.py'], 'message': "Add histogram to the report of tasks' results

Add two histogram charts to the set of charts of the HTML report
produced by the 'rally task plot2html' command. The first histogram
depicts the whole task, whereas the second histogram depicts every
atomic action of the task.
For every of these two histograms, there is a drop down menu from which
the user can select the type of the histogram. The type of the histogram
is described by the method that was used to calculate the number of
bins. At the moment, there are four types and it is easy to add more.
In general, a histogram has on its X axis a continuous variable
separated in a number of bins (specific ranges) and on its Y axis the
frequency of events for every bin.
In Rally's case, the histogram has on its X axis the duration of a
benchmark scenario in seconds, separated in a number of bins, and on its
Y axis the number of iterations that fall into every defined bin.

Change-Id: Ibb8d9a7bab40a00adff25df33bac6bb0e71dfe41
Implements: blueprint cli-task-plot2html-histogram
"}]
commit_message:
Add histogram to the report of tasks' results

Add two histogram charts to the set of charts of the HTML report
produced by the 'rally task plot2html' command. The first histogram
depicts the whole task, whereas the second histogram depicts every
atomic action of the task.
For every of these two histograms, there is a drop down menu from which
the user can select the type of the histogram. The type of the histogram
is described by the method that was used to calculate the number of
bins. At the moment, there are four types and it is easy to add more.
In general, a histogram has on its X axis a continuous variable
separated in a number of bins (specific ranges) and on its Y axis the
frequency of events for every bin.
In Rally's case, the histogram has on its X axis the duration of a
benchmark scenario in seconds, separated in a number of bins, and on its
Y axis the number of iterations that fall into every defined bin.

Change-Id: Ibb8d9a7bab40a00adff25df33bac6bb0e71dfe41
Implements: blueprint cli-task-plot2html-histogram

Add resolving inline expressions

 * We allow to resolve something like:
   - /{$.project_id}/servers
   - {$.auth_token}

Change-Id: Ic2a5a32b42c168bac021ff1e96d1dae8bac6647e

commit_message:
Fix Jenkins translation jobs

The jobs nova-propose-translation-update and
nova-upstream-translation-update do not update from
transifex since our po files contain duplicate entries where
obsolete entries duplicate normal entries.

Remove all obsolete entries to fix the jobs.

Change-Id: I7f51922472f12f3a13feb71a6fb344076781d7e9
Closes-Bug: #1299349

commit_message:
Glance: Allow configuring default_log_levels

Allow a custom value for 'default_log_levels' to be set for both the
Glance registry and API.

Allows setting 'eventlet.wsgi.server=DEBUG' which is useful for tracking
each HTTP request.

Also allows setting a log level for any middleware etc.

Change-Id: I2a791b707fd91ba2d4ca7217b5189969a110c0c9

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-03 23:07:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/exception.py'], 'message': 'Require admin context for interfaces on ext network

Currently any user can attach an interface to a neutron
external network, if the neutron plugin supports the port
binding extension.
In this case, nova will create neutron ports using the admin
client, thus bypassing neutron authZ checks for creating ports
on external networks.

This patch adds a check in nova to verify the API request has an
admin context when a request for an interface is made on a
neutron external network.

Change-Id: I5fb0bdcbf19eb82746ea3b192c1f65899bfb3c0b
Closes-Bug: 1284718
'}]
commit_message:
Require admin context for interfaces on ext network

Currently any user can attach an interface to a neutron
external network, if the neutron plugin supports the port
binding extension.
In this case, nova will create neutron ports using the admin
client, thus bypassing neutron authZ checks for creating ports
on external networks.

This patch adds a check in nova to verify the API request has an
admin context when a request for an interface is made on a
neutron external network.

Change-Id: I5fb0bdcbf19eb82746ea3b192c1f65899bfb3c0b
Closes-Bug: 1284718

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-03 11:57:20.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/plugins/vanilla/v2_3_0/config.py', 'sahara/plugins/vanilla/v2_3_0/resources/topology.sh', 'sahara/plugins/vanilla/v2_3_0/scaling.py', 'sahara/plugins/vanilla/v2_3_0/config_helper.py'], 'message': 'Added rackawareness to Hadoop 2 in vanilla plugin

* Now Hadoop 2.3.0 in vanilla is able to push topology data for
  datanodes and nodemanagers
* Only 3-level topology (rackawareness) pushes to nodes. Why 4-level is
  not? Because this is not implemented in YARN yet (see YARN-18 and YARN-19):
  https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-8468
* Even if admin configures 4-level topology configs Sahara will force
  down to 3-level.

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Reshetnyak <sreshetniak@mirantis.com>

Partially implements: blueprint vanilla-plugin-hadoop-2

Change-Id: If5b93dde1f6aaaf619def60634da8c8819a3c75a
'}]
commit_message:
Added rackawareness to Hadoop 2 in vanilla plugin

* Now Hadoop 2.3.0 in vanilla is able to push topology data for
  datanodes and nodemanagers
* Only 3-level topology (rackawareness) pushes to nodes. Why 4-level is
  not? Because this is not implemented in YARN yet (see YARN-18 and YARN-19):
  https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-8468
* Even if admin configures 4-level topology configs Sahara will force
  down to 3-level.

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Reshetnyak <sreshetniak@mirantis.com>

Partially implements: blueprint vanilla-plugin-hadoop-2

Change-Id: If5b93dde1f6aaaf619def60634da8c8819a3c75a

commit_message:
Remove security group egress rules

The egress security group rules were too restrictive, blocking
necessary traffic, including cloud-init metadata.
Fixes https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1080638

Change-Id: Ia11f4a81d56d76418530dab6b09478648a1cfbfd

commit_message:
Updating the setup development environment docs for icehouse

Changes
* rewording title paragraph to be more descriptive of the document
* adding a link to devstack.org in the "... inside DevStack" section
* adding a sentence about developing on OSX to the "... inside DevStack"
section
* changing the toctree link to the OSX VM install doc to be inline
* minor grammar cleanup on section titles
* adding a header paragraph to the ui dev environ page
* rewording the "... as part of DevStack" section to be similar to dev
environ doc
* minor cleanups to ui dev environ page
* correcting sahara-dashboard location in /opt/stack

Partial-Implements: blueprint update-docs-icehouse

Change-Id: Ideed96512ee7f28280577f2520bacc620952e305

commit_message:
Stop removing ip allocations on port delete

The _delete_port() method was manually removing related
IPAllocation instances despite the existence of a perfectly
good cascade deletion relationship in the model.  This patch
puts an end to that nonsense and the potential for deadlock that
it represented.

Closes-bug: #1288379
Related-Bug: #1283522

Change-Id: Ib31550fa9000fc75768a327cb6cc1c419e06568f
(cherry picked from commit 2648aa3561d23e1215e0cc6f446253e5df56c8f6)

subject: Simplify ip allocation/recycling to relieve db pressure
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 2711, 'name': 'Zhang Hua', 'display_name': 'Zhang Hua', 'email': 'joshua.zhang@canonical.com', 'username': 'zhhuabj'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6659, 'name': 'Paul Michali', 'email': 'pc@michali.net', 'username': 'pcm'}, {'_account_id': 7448, 'name': 'Carl Baldwin', 'email': 'carl@ecbaldwin.net', 'username': 'carl-baldwin'}, {'_account_id': 9787, 'name': 'Big Switch CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@bigswitch.com', 'username': 'bsn', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9925, 'name': 'Midokura CI', 'username': 'midokura', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10153, 'name': 'One Convergence CI', 'email': 'oc-neutron-test@oneconvergence.com', 'username': 'oneconvergence', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10192, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'cisco-openstack-neutron-ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_neutron_ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-01 23:32:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/models_v2.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/nicira/test_networkgw.py'], 'message': "Simplify ip allocation/recycling to relieve db pressure

I found that multiple calls to delete_port can pile up on the
_recycle_ip operation.  This patch simplifies this operation.  It
reduces the _recycle_ip operation to a single row delete in the ip
allocations table and doesn't touch the availability table.

To acheive the recycling of ips in a pool, this code runs a more
complex operation of rebuilding the availability table when it is
exhausted.  Only one API process will perform this more expensive
operation and others waiting for allocation will immediately benefit.
The amortized cost of this operation is much less than the cumulative
cost of running the more expensive _recycle_ip operation for every
port delete.

IP allocation behaves a bit differently with this patch.  Instead of
giving out the first IP available in a pool, the entire pool will be
allocated before wrapping around and recycling ip addresses that have
been released.  This is a desirable feature as it puts ip addresses in
a sort of quarantine after they are released.  It is easier to
distinguish newly allocated ips from old ones.

Change-Id: Ia55b66128de9986e075b0f87acc401d211cd91d3
Closes-Bug: #1252506
Closes-Bug: #1257815
(cherry picked from commit 89f25623a4345b5044a58cff36e7fd103c6b88e8)
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify ip allocation/recycling to relieve db pressure

I found that multiple calls to delete_port can pile up on the
_recycle_ip operation.  This patch simplifies this operation.  It
reduces the _recycle_ip operation to a single row delete in the ip
allocations table and doesn't touch the availability table.

To acheive the recycling of ips in a pool, this code runs a more
complex operation of rebuilding the availability table when it is
exhausted.  Only one API process will perform this more expensive
operation and others waiting for allocation will immediately benefit.
The amortized cost of this operation is much less than the cumulative
cost of running the more expensive _recycle_ip operation for every
port delete.

IP allocation behaves a bit differently with this patch.  Instead of
giving out the first IP available in a pool, the entire pool will be
allocated before wrapping around and recycling ip addresses that have
been released.  This is a desirable feature as it puts ip addresses in
a sort of quarantine after they are released.  It is easier to
distinguish newly allocated ips from old ones.

Change-Id: Ia55b66128de9986e075b0f87acc401d211cd91d3
Closes-Bug: #1252506
Closes-Bug: #1257815
(cherry picked from commit 89f25623a4345b5044a58cff36e7fd103c6b88e8)

commit_message:
Improve Host Aggregates handle method.

Added update conditions to the handle method (remove
and add hosts).
Previously, to perform an update, first all existing hosts
were removed and then all new hosts were added.
Now, the update method only
remove or add the changed hosts.
Added missing unit tests for the update.

Change-Id: I52acdd1226be504cf2d0cf029353dbf80e4aa01a
Closes-bug: #1287192
(cherry picked from commit 8f4331a6bdc12bb7632f2d170cc94176e0897fbf)

commit_message:
Catch InstanceNotFound exceptions for V2 API instance_actions

Use the common.get_instance method to get the instance object
in the V2 API instance_actions extension rather than call
the compute api directly. The utility function
handes InstanceNotFound exceptions and tranlsates them to HTTPNotFound
rather than letting them propagate up causing a traceback.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>

Change-Id: I1e69fed0c7c0c611fcfd48abbd4b4e0b1c8b403f
Closes-Bug: 1271146

commit_message:
